Pre-Game Insights: Andre Russell requested a period of rest and recovery
Jason Holder played five back-to-back five tests against England and South Africa
Daren Sammy remarked that facing a strong South Africa side is an excellent opportunity for the team to reset and refocus with their game plan
Miscellaneous Highlights: The West Indies Men’s T20 team have won four of their last five series
In the ICC Men’s T20I Team Rankings, West Indies are number 4 and South Africa are number 5
Tickets for the T20I Series against South Africa at the Brian Lara Cricket Academy, Trinidad are available now to buy online from the Windies Tickets service
Others: The team management unit for the series includes Head Coach Daren Sammy, Assistant Coaches Rayon Griffith, Floyd Reifer, Ramesh Subasinghe, Physiotherapist Denis Byam, Strength & Conditioning Coach Ronald Rogers, Team Masseuse Fitzbert Alleyne, Team Manager Rawl Lewis, Team Analyst Avenesh Seetaram, Team Media & Content Officer John Phillips
The West Indies Men’s T20 team have just missed out on a Semi-Final final place at the recently concluded ICC Men’s T20 World Cup that was hosted in the Caribbean

The match schedule for the series includes 23 August – 1st T20I, West Indies v South Africa at the Brian Lara Cricket Academy, 25 August – 2nd T20I West Indies v South Africa at the Brian Lara Cricket Academy, 27 August – 3rd T20I West Indies v South Africa at the Brian Lara Cricket Academy

Fans in the Caribbean can Watch Live on RUSH SPORTS or via the new Flow Sports App or the SportsMax App. Fans around the world can Listen Live to ball-by-ball radio commentary on the Windies Cricket YouTube page and can follow Live ball-by-ball scores on the windiescricket.com Match Centre
